verses.verse: וַֽיְהִי֙ <WH1961> way·hî came בִּשְׁנַ֣ת <WH8141> biš·naṯ year ( A Call to Justice and Mercy) אַרְבַּ֔ע <WH702> ’ar·ba‘ In the fourth לְדָרְיָ֖וֶשׁ <WH1867> lə·ḏā·rə·yā·weš Darius, הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ <WH4428> ham·me·leḵ of King הָיָ֨ה <WH1961> hā·yāh ... דְבַר־ <WH1697> ḏə·ḇar- the word יְהוָ֜ה <WH3068> Yah·weh of the LORD אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- to זְכַרְיָ֗ה <WH2148> zə·ḵar·yāh Zechariah בְּאַרְבָּעָ֛ה <WH702> bə·’ar·bā·‘āh on the fourth לַחֹ֥דֶשׁ <WH2320> la·ḥō·ḏeš month, הַתְּשִׁעִ֖י <WH8671> hat·tə·ši·‘î day of the ninth בְּכִסְלֵֽו׃ <WH3691> bə·ḵis·lêw the month of Chislev. ( Chislev is the ninth month of the Hebrew lunar calendar, usually occurring within the months of November and December.)

וַיִּשְׁלַח֙ <WH7971> way·yiš·laḥ had sent בֵּֽית־ <WH1008> bêṯ- vvv אֵ֔ל <WH1008> ’êl Now the people of Bethel שַׂר־ <WH8272> śar- vvv אֶ֕צֶר <WH8272> ’e·ṣer Sharezer וְרֶ֥גֶם <WH7278> wə·re·ḡem vvv מֶ֖לֶךְ <WH7278> me·leḵ and Regem-melech, וַֽאֲנָשָׁ֑יו <WH582> wa·’ă·nā·šāw along with their men, ( Or Bethel-sharezer had sent Regem-melech, along with his men,) לְחַלּ֖וֹת <WH2470> lə·ḥal·lō·wṯ to plead אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - פְּנֵ֥י <WH6440> pə·nê before יְהוָֽה׃ <WH3068> Yah·weh the LORD

לֵאמֹ֗ר <WH559> lê·mōr by asking אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- ... הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ <WH3548> hak·kō·hă·nîm the priests אֲשֶׁר֙ <WH834> ’ă·šer - לְבֵית־ <WH1004> lə·ḇêṯ- of the house יְהוָ֣ה <WH3068> Yah·weh of the LORD צְבָא֔וֹת <WH6635> ṣə·ḇā·’ō·wṯ of Hosts, וְאֶל־ <WH413> wə·’el- as well as הַנְּבִיאִ֖ים <WH5030> han·nə·ḇî·’îm the prophets לֵאמֹ֑ר <WH559> lê·mōr ..., הַֽאֶבְכֶּה֙ <WH1058> ha·’eḇ·keh “ Should I weep בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ <WH2320> ba·ḥō·ḏeš month, הַחֲמִשִׁ֔י <WH2549> ha·ḥă·mi·šî in the fifth הִנָּזֵ֕ר <WH5144> hin·nā·zêr and fast כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר <WH834> ka·’ă·šer as עָשִׂ֔יתִי <WH6213> ‘ā·śî·ṯî I have done זֶ֖ה <WH2088> zeh these כַּמֶּ֥ה <WH4100> kam·meh many שָׁנִֽים׃פ <WH8141> šā·nîm years? ”

וַיְהִ֛י <WH1961> way·hî came דְּבַר־ <WH1697> də·ḇar- Then the word יְהוָ֥ה <WH3068> Yah·weh of the LORD צְבָא֖וֹת <WH6635> ṣə·ḇā·’ō·wṯ of Hosts אֵלַ֥י <WH413> ’ê·lay to me, לֵאמֹֽר׃ <WH559> lê·mōr saying,

אֱמֹר֙ <WH559> ’ĕ·mōr “ Ask אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- ... כָּל־ <WH3605> kāl- all עַ֣ם <WH5971> ‘am the people הָאָ֔רֶץ <WH776> hā·’ā·reṣ of the land וְאֶל־ <WH413> wə·’el- ... הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים <WH3548> hak·kō·hă·nîm and the priests לֵאמֹ֑ר <WH559> lê·mōr ..., כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- ‘ When צַמְתֶּ֨ם <WH6684> ṣam·tem you fasted וְסָפ֜וֹד <WH5594> wə·sā·p̄ō·wḏ and mourned בַּחֲמִישִׁ֣י <WH2549> ba·ḥă·mî·šî in the fifth וּבַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י <WH7637> ū·ḇaš·šə·ḇî·‘î and seventh months וְזֶה֙ <WH2088> wə·zeh for these שִׁבְעִ֣ים <WH7657> šiḇ·‘îm seventy שָׁנָ֔ה <WH8141> šā·nāh years, הֲצ֥וֹם <WH6684> hă·ṣō·wm that you fasted צַמְתֻּ֖נִי <WH6684> ṣam·tu·nî ...? אָֽנִי׃ <WH589> ’ā·nî was it really  for Me

וְכִ֥י <WH3588> wə·ḵî And when תֹאכְל֖וּ <WH398> ṯō·ḵə·lū you were eating וְכִ֣י <WH3588> wə·ḵî ... תִשְׁתּ֑וּ <WH8354> ṯiš·tū and drinking, הֲל֤וֹא <WH3808> hă·lō·w were you not אַתֶּם֙ <WH859> ’at·tem [doing so] הָאֹ֣כְלִ֔ים <WH398> hā·’ō·ḵə·lîm ... וְאַתֶּ֖ם <WH859> wə·’at·tem ... הַשֹּׁתִֽים׃ <WH8354> haš·šō·ṯîm simply for yourselves?

הֲל֣וֹא <WH3808> hă·lō·w Are these not אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הַדְּבָרִ֗ים <WH1697> had·də·ḇā·rîm the words אֲשֶׁ֨ר <WH834> ’ă·šer that קָרָ֤א <WH7121> qā·rā proclaimed יְהוָה֙ <WH3068> Yah·weh the LORD בְּיַד֙ <WH3027> bə·yaḏ through הַנְּבִיאִ֣ים <WH5030> han·nə·ḇî·’îm prophets, הָרִֽאשֹׁנִ֔ים <WH7223> hā·ri·šō·nîm the earlier בִּהְי֤וֹת <WH1961> bih·yō·wṯ were יְרוּשָׁלִַ֙ם֙ <WH3389> yə·rū·šā·lim when Jerusalem יֹשֶׁ֣בֶת <WH3427> yō·še·ḇeṯ populous וּשְׁלֵוָ֔ה <WH7961> ū·šə·lê·wāh and prosperous, וְעָרֶ֖יהָ <WH5892> wə·‘ā·re·hā towns סְבִיבֹתֶ֑יהָ <WH5439> sə·ḇî·ḇō·ṯe·hā and its surrounding וְהַנֶּ֥גֶב <WH5045> wə·han·ne·ḡeḇ and the Negev וְהַשְּׁפֵלָ֖ה <WH8219> wə·haš·šə·p̄ê·lāh and the foothills ( Hebrew Shephelah or lowlands; that is, the western foothills of Judea) יֹשֵֽׁב׃פ <WH3427> yō·šêḇ were inhabited? ’”

וַֽיְהִי֙ <WH1961> way·hî came דְּבַר־ <WH1697> də·ḇar- Then the word יְהוָ֔ה <WH3068> Yah·weh of the LORD אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- to זְכַרְיָ֖ה <WH2148> zə·ḵar·yāh Zechariah, לֵאמֹֽר׃ <WH559> lê·mōr saying,

כֹּ֥ה <WH3541> kōh “ This is what אָמַ֛ר <WH559> ’ā·mar says: יְהוָ֥ה <WH3068> Yah·weh the LORD צְבָא֖וֹת <WH6635> ṣə·ḇā·’ō·wṯ of Hosts לֵאמֹ֑ר <WH559> lê·mōr ... מִשְׁפַּ֤ט <WH4941> miš·paṭ justice. אֱמֶת֙ <WH571> ’ĕ·meṯ true שְׁפֹ֔טוּ <WH8199> šə·p̄ō·ṭū ‘ Administer וְחֶ֣סֶד <WH2617> wə·ḥe·seḏ loving devotion ( Forms of the Hebrew chesed are translated here and in most cases throughout the Scriptures as loving devotion; the range of meaning includes love, goodness, kindness, faithfulness, and mercy, as well as loyalty to a covenant.) וְרַֽחֲמִ֔ים <WH7356> wə·ra·ḥă·mîm and compassion עֲשׂ֖וּ <WH6213> ‘ă·śū Show אִ֥ישׁ <WH376> ’îš one אֶת־ <WH854> ’eṯ- to אָחִֽיו׃ <WH251> ’ā·ḥîw another.

וְאַלְמָנָ֧ה <WH490> wə·’al·mā·nāh the widow וְיָת֛וֹם <WH3490> wə·yā·ṯō·wm or the fatherless, גֵּ֥ר <WH1616> gêr the foreigner וְעָנִ֖י <WH6041> wə·‘ā·nî or the poor. אַֽל־ <WH408> ’al- Do not תַּעֲשֹׁ֑קוּ <WH6231> ta·‘ă·šō·qū oppress וְרָעַת֙ <WH7451> wə·rā·‘aṯ evil אִ֣ישׁ <WH376> ’îš against one אָחִ֔יו <WH251> ’ā·ḥîw another. ’ אַֽל־ <WH408> ’al- And do not תַּחְשְׁב֖וּ <WH2803> taḥ·šə·ḇū plot בִּלְבַבְכֶֽם׃ <WH3824> bil·ḇaḇ·ḵem in your hearts

וַיְמָאֲנ֣וּ <WH3985> way·mā·’ă·nū But they refused לְהַקְשִׁ֔יב <WH7181> lə·haq·šîḇ to pay attention וַיִּתְּנ֥וּ <WH5414> way·yit·tə·nū and turned כָתֵ֖ף <WH3802> ḵā·ṯêp̄ shoulder; סֹרָ֑רֶת <WH5637> sō·rā·reṯ a stubborn וְאָזְנֵיהֶ֖ם <WH241> wə·’ā·zə·nê·hem their ears הִכְבִּ֥ידוּ <WH3513> hiḵ·bî·ḏū they stopped up מִשְּׁמֽוֹעַ׃ <WH8085> miš·šə·mō·w·a‘ from hearing. ( Hebrew they made their ears too heavy to hear)

וְלִבָּ֞ם <WH3820> wə·lib·bām their hearts שָׂ֣מוּ <WH7760> śā·mū They made שָׁמִ֗יר <WH8068> šā·mîr [like] flint מִ֠שְּׁמוֹעַ <WH8085> miš·šə·mō·w·a‘ and would not listen to אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הַתּוֹרָ֤ה <WH8451> hat·tō·w·rāh the law וְאֶת־ <WH853> wə·’eṯ- or הַדְּבָרִים֙ <WH1697> had·də·ḇā·rîm to the words אֲשֶׁ֨ר <WH834> ’ă·šer that שָׁלַ֜ח <WH7971> šā·laḥ had sent יְהוָ֤ה <WH3068> Yah·weh the LORD צְבָאוֹת֙ <WH6635> ṣə·ḇā·’ō·wṯ of Hosts בְּרוּח֔וֹ <WH7307> bə·rū·ḥōw by His Spirit בְּיַ֖ד <WH3027> bə·yaḏ through הַנְּבִיאִ֣ים <WH5030> han·nə·ḇî·’îm prophets. הָרִֽאשֹׁנִ֑ים <WH7223> hā·ri·šō·nîm the earlier וַֽיְהִי֙ <WH1961> way·hî came קֶ֣צֶף <WH7110> qe·ṣep̄ anger גָּד֔וֹל <WH1419> gā·ḏō·wl Therefore great מֵאֵ֖ת <WH854> mê·’êṯ from יְהוָ֥ה <WH3068> Yah·weh the LORD צְבָאֽוֹת׃ <WH6635> ṣə·ḇā·’ō·wṯ of Hosts.

וַיְהִ֥י <WH1961> way·hî And כַאֲשֶׁר־ <WH834> ḵa·’ă·šer- just as קָרָ֖א <WH7121> qā·rā I had called וְלֹ֣א <WH3808> wə·lō and they would not שָׁמֵ֑עוּ <WH8085> šā·mê·‘ū listen, כֵּ֤ן <WH3651> kên so יִקְרְאוּ֙ <WH7121> yiq·rə·’ū when they called וְלֹ֣א <WH3808> wə·lō I would not אֶשְׁמָ֔ע <WH8085> ’eš·mā‘ listen, אָמַ֖ר <WH559> ’ā·mar says יְהוָ֥ה <WH3068> Yah·weh the LORD צְבָאֽוֹת׃ <WH6635> ṣə·ḇā·’ō·wṯ of Hosts.

וְאֵ֣סָעֲרֵ֗ם <WH5590> wə·’ê·sā·‘ă·rêm But I scattered them with a whirlwind עַ֤ל <WH5921> ‘al among כָּל־ <WH3605> kāl- all הַגּוֹיִם֙ <WH1471> hag·gō·w·yim the nations אֲשֶׁ֣ר <WH834> ’ă·šer that לֹֽא־ <WH3808> lō- they had not יְדָע֔וּם <WH3045> yə·ḏā·‘ūm known, וְהָאָ֙רֶץ֙ <WH776> wə·hā·’ā·reṣ and the land נָשַׁ֣מָּה <WH8074> nā·šam·māh was left desolate אַֽחֲרֵיהֶ֔ם <WH310> ’a·ḥă·rê·hem behind them מֵֽעֹבֵ֖ר <WH5674> mê·‘ō·ḇêr so that no one could come וּמִשָּׁ֑ב <WH7725> ū·miš·šāḇ or go. וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ <WH7760> way·yā·śî·mū Thus they turned אֶֽרֶץ־ <WH776> ’e·reṣ- land חֶמְדָּ֖ה <WH2532> ḥem·dāh the pleasant לְשַׁמָּֽה׃פ <WH8047> lə·šam·māh into a desolation. ”
